p: Assayed EOs and the mixture showed different degrees of growth inhibition against the eighteen tested Salmonella isolates ( Table 2). C. zeylanicum and S. aromaticum, alone or in combination, induced the largest inhibition zones versus almost all the evaluated strains, whereas low antibacterial activity was observed for the remaining EOs. The overall inhibition zone for tested EOs ranged from 7.0 mm to 17.0 mm against S. Enteritidis strains. The lowest potential was observed in A. triphylla, C. citratus, L. cubeba and M. piperita EOs, where inhibition zone average was 7.0 mm. C. zeylanicum and S. aromaticum, alone or in combination, induced the largest inhibition zones versus almost all the evaluated strains. The inhibition zone for C. zeylanicum ranged from 7.0 mm to 17.0 mm, for S. aromaticum from 9.0 mm to 13.0 mm and for the mixture from 10.0 mm to 17.0 mm.
